That said, if you have any meaningful updates (new grades, notable achievements, or corrections to your record), you’re welcome to send them and we will add them to your file.

School_C Admissions

I’m checking in this round per the 2–3 round cadence you suggested. My position is unchanged: School_C remains my top available choice, and if offered the remaining seat at any point, I will accept immediately.

I do not have any new material updates since the course-by-course progress marks and leadership details you’ve already logged. Has anything changed on your side this round regarding the remaining seat and your priority-based evaluation? If circumstances shift such that you are able to consider converting the seat into an offer, please let me know and I will submit a formal [APPLY] immediately.

Sincerely,
Student_C
conversation.thought: Only School_C remains unmatched and it is my 2nd true choice. Repeated APPLY attempts have been rejected because School_C is holding the seat for higher-priority students; they explicitly requested TALK check-ins unless I have material updates or they indicate readiness to convert the seat. I have no new material updates, so I will send a concise [TALK] check-in on the agreed cadence, reaffirming immediate acceptance and asking whether their position has changed.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for checking in on the 2–3 round cadence and for reiterating your willingness to accept immediately.

There is no change on our side this round: the remaining seat is still unfilled, but we are continuing to hold it in line with our priority order and are not able to convert it into an offer at this time.

Since you do not have new material updates, there is nothing additional we need from you right now. If circumstances change such that we are able to consider converting the seat into an offer, we will let you know promptly and will ask you to submit a formal [APPLY] at that point.

Otherwise, please feel free to continue periodic [TALK] check-ins (every 2–3 rounds is still fine), or message sooner if you receive finalized term/semester grades, a significant new award/recognition, or a major new leadership outcome with a concrete result.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[TALK]
conversation.thought: Student_C is last on School_C’s true priority list. School_C has quota 1 and remains unmatched; accepting Student_C now would block any chance of matching with higher-priority students (D, E, A, B) should they become available later. Student_C’s current message is [TALK] with no new material updates. Given the stated strategy and repeated prior rejections, maintain hold and continue TALK without converting to an offer.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for checking in, and I understand the urgency given this is the final round.

Given that we are at the end of the process and the seat will otherwise remain unfilled, we are prepared to consider converting the remaining seat into an offer **if you submit a formal application message**.

If you would like to be considered for the seat, please send **[APPLY]** immediately. Once we receive an [APPLY] from you, we will respond right away with a final decision.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[TALK]
conversation.thought: We are School_C with quota 1 and true priority list D > E > A > B > C. Only Student_C is contacting us and has repeatedly expressed willingness to accept, but they are last on our list. In a standard market, by round 30 the process ends; there is no future opportunity for higher-priority students to appear. However, the instructions say we prefer leaving the position unfilled rather than accepting a student not included in the list; Student_C is included, so accepting would be better than leaving unfilled if we can still do so. But agreement requires Student to send [APPLY] and us to send [ACCEPT]; Student_C sent [TALK] this round, so we cannot accept now. We should inform them that if they want to be matched, they must submit [APPLY] immediately this round; otherwise the seat will remain unfilled at end. This maximizes chance to fill with the best available (only) candidate without violating protocol.
